<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22" lineLink="#ad78e062f62e0d6e453941fb4ca843e4d"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define DEBUG&#95;TYPE &quot;machine-scheduler&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This scheduler implements a different scheduling algorithm than</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// GenericScheduler.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are several specific architecture behaviours that can&#39;t be modelled</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for GenericScheduler:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . When accessing the result of an SGPR load instruction, you have to wait</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for all the SGPR load instructions before your current instruction to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have finished.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . When accessing the result of an VGPR load instruction, you have to wait</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for all the VGPR load instructions previous to the VGPR load instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// you are interested in to finish.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . The less the register pressure, the best load latencies are hidden</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Moreover some specifities (like the fact a lot of instructions in the shader</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have few dependencies) makes the generic scheduler have some unpredictable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// behaviours. For example when register pressure becomes high, it can either</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// manage to prevent register pressure from going too high, or it can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// increase register pressure even more than if it hadn&#39;t taken register</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pressure into account.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Also some other bad behaviours are generated, like loading at the beginning</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the shader a constant in VGPR you won&#39;t need until the end of the shader.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The scheduling problem for SI can distinguish three main parts:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . Hiding high latencies (texture sampling, etc)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . Hiding low latencies (SGPR constant loading, etc)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . Keeping register usage low for better latency hiding and general</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   performance</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Some other things can also affect performance, but are hard to predict</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (cache usage, the fact the HW can issue several instructions from different</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// wavefronts if different types, etc)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This scheduler tries to solve the scheduling problem by dividing it into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// simpler sub-problems. It divides the instructions into blocks, schedules</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// locally inside the blocks where it takes care of low latencies, and then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// chooses the order of the blocks by taking care of high latencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Dividing the instructions into blocks helps control keeping register</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// usage low.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First the instructions are put into blocks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   We want the blocks help control register usage and hide high latencies</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   later. To help control register usage, we typically want all local</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   computations, when for example you create a result that can be consumed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   right away, to be contained in a block. Block inputs and outputs would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   typically be important results that are needed in several locations of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   the shader. Since we do want blocks to help hide high latencies, we want</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   the instructions inside the block to have a minimal set of dependencies</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   on high latencies. It will make it easy to pick blocks to hide specific</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   high latencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   The block creation algorithm is divided into several steps, and several</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   variants can be tried during the scheduling process.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Second the order of the instructions inside the blocks is chosen.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   At that step we do take into account only register usage and hiding</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   low latency instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Third the block order is chosen, there we try to hide high latencies</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and keep register usage low.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// After the third step, a pass is done to improve the hiding of low</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// latencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Actually when talking about &#39;low latency&#39; or &#39;high latency&#39; it includes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// both the latency to get the cache (or global mem) data go to the register,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and the bandwidth limitations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Increasing the number of active wavefronts helps hide the former, but it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// doesn&#39;t solve the latter, thus why even if wavefront count is high, we have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to try have as many instructions hiding high latencies as possible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The OpenCL doc says for example latency of 400 cycles for a global mem</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// access, which is hidden by 10 instructions if the wavefront count is 10</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Some figures taken from AMD docs:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both texture and constant L1 caches are 4-way associative with 64 bytes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// lines.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Constant cache is shared with 4 CUs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For texture sampling, the address generation unit receives 4 texture</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// addresses per cycle, thus we could expect texture sampling latency to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// equivalent to 4 instructions in the very best case (a VGPR is 64 work items,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions in a wavefront group are executed every 4 cycles),</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or 16 instructions if the other wavefronts associated to the 3 other VALUs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the CU do texture sampling too. (Don&#39;t take these figures too seriously,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// as I&#39;m not 100% sure of the computation)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Data exports should get similar latency.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For constant loading, the cache is shader with 4 CUs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The doc says &quot;a throughput of 16B/cycle for each of the 4 Compute Unit&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// I guess if the other CU don&#39;t read the cache, it can go up to 64B/cycle.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It means a simple s&#95;buffer&#95;load should take one instruction to hide, as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// well as a s&#95;buffer&#95;loadx2 and potentially a s&#95;buffer&#95;loadx8 if on the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cache line.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As of today the driver doesn&#39;t preload the constants in cache, thus the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// first loads get extra latency. The doc says global memory access can be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 300-600 cycles. We do not specially take that into account when scheduling</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// As we expect the driver to be able to preload the constants soon.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// common code //</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SIScheduleBlock::traceCandidate(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SISchedCandidate &amp;Cand) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;  SU(&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; Cand.SU-&gt;NodeNum &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;) &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; <a href="#a40b6772594ba487ff05488a83b4d63f6">getReasonStr</a>(Cand.Reason);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SIScheduleBlock::tryCandidateTopDown(SISchedCandidate &amp;Cand,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal">                                          SISchedCandidate &amp;TryCand) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Initialize the candidate if needed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Cand.isValid()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal">    TryCand.Reason = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06a31669aae44fa7e6414dd5cd81e2b16f8">NodeOrder</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Cand.SGPRUsage &gt; 60 &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#ac6bcd3ad1ec3f1be308048693474bd19">SISched::tryLess</a>(TryCand.SGPRUsage, Cand.SGPRUsage,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="normal">                       TryCand, Cand, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06aefdc051657574f00e43b0fa1f87e7336">RegUsage</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Schedule low latency instructions as top as possible.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Order of priority is:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . Low latency instructions which do not depend on other low latency</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   instructions we haven&#39;t waited for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . Other instructions which do not depend on low latency instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   we haven&#39;t waited for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . Low latencies</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// . All other instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Goal is to get: low latency instructions - independent instructions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     - (eventually some more low latency instructions)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     - instructions that depend on the first low latency instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If in the block there is a lot of constant loads, the SGPR usage</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// could go quite high, thus above the arbitrary limit of 60 will encourage</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use the already loaded constants (in order to release some SGPRs) before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loading more.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sisched/#ac6bcd3ad1ec3f1be308048693474bd19">SISched::tryLess</a>(TryCand.HasLowLatencyNonWaitedParent,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">                       Cand.HasLowLatencyNonWaitedParent,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">                       TryCand, Cand, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">SIScheduleCandReason::Depth</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SIScheduleBlock::initRegPressure(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> BeginBlock,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> EndBlock) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="normal">  IntervalPressure Pressure, BotPressure;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="normal">  RegPressureTracker RPTracker(Pressure), BotRPTracker(BotPressure);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="normal">  LiveIntervals &#42;LIS = DAG-&gt;getLIS();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="normal">  MachineRegisterInfo &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a> = DAG-&gt;getMRI();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="normal">  DAG-&gt;initRPTracker(TopRPTracker);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="normal">  DAG-&gt;initRPTracker(BotRPTracker);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="normal">  DAG-&gt;initRPTracker(RPTracker);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Goes though all SU. RPTracker captures what had to be alive for the SUs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to execute, and what is still alive at the end.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SUnit&#42; SU : ScheduledSUnits) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal">    RPTracker.setPos(SU-&gt;getInstr());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">    RPTracker.advance();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Close the RPTracker to finalize live ins/outs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">  RPTracker.closeRegion();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Initialize the live ins and live outs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  TopRPTracker.addLiveRegs(RPTracker.getPressure().LiveInRegs);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">  BotRPTracker.addLiveRegs(RPTracker.getPressure().LiveOutRegs);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Do not Track Physical Registers, because it messes up.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;RegMaskPair : RPTracker.getPressure().LiveInRegs) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (RegMaskPair.RegUnit.isVirtual())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal">      LiveInRegs.insert(RegMaskPair.RegUnit);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">  LiveOutRegs.clear();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There is several possibilities to distinguish:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) Reg is not input to any instruction in the block, but is output of one</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) 1) + read in the block and not needed after it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3) 1) + read in the block but needed in another block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 4) Reg is input of an instruction but another block will read it too</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 5) Reg is input of an instruction and then rewritten in the block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    result is not read in the block (implies used in another block)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 6) Reg is input of an instruction and then rewritten in the block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    result is read in the block and not needed in another block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 7) Reg is input of an instruction and then rewritten in the block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    result is read in the block but also needed in another block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LiveInRegs will contains all the regs in situation 4, 5, 6, 7</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We want LiveOutRegs to contain only Regs whose content will be read after</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in another block, and whose content was written in the current block,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that is we want it to get 1, 3, 5, 7</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since we made the MIs of a block to be packed all together before</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scheduling, then the LiveIntervals were correct, and the RPTracker was</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// able to correctly handle 5 vs 6, 2 vs 3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (Note: This is not sufficient for RPTracker to not do mistakes for case 4)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The RPTracker&#39;s LiveOutRegs has 1, 3, (some correct or incorrect)4, 5, 7</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Comparing to LiveInRegs is not sufficient to differentiate 4 vs 5, 7</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The use of findDefBetween removes the case 4</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ProposedColor = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-aarch64a57fploadbalancing-cpp-/#afcb9ac67c90816f55d217d4f629e1047">Color</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::vector&lt;int&gt; AdditionalElements;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We don&#39;t want to put in the same block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// two high latency instructions that depend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// on each other.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// One way would be to check canAddEdge</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in both directions, but that currently is not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// enough because there the high latency order is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// enforced (via links).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Instead, look at the dependencies between the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// high latency instructions and deduce if it is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a data dependency or not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> j : FormingGroup) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasSubGraph;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><Highlight kind="normal">        std::vector&lt;int&gt; SubGraph;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By construction (topological order), if SU and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93; are linked, DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93; is necessary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the parent graph of SU.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><Highlight kind="normal">        SubGraph = DAG-&gt;GetTopo()-&gt;GetSubGraph(SU, DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               HasSubGraph);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!HasSubGraph);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><Highlight kind="normal">        SubGraph = DAG-&gt;GetTopo()-&gt;GetSubGraph(DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;j&#93;, SU,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               HasSubGraph);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!HasSubGraph)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No dependencies between each other</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SubGraph.size() &gt; 5) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Too many elements would be required to be added to the block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="normal">          CompatibleGroup = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="normal">        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check the type of dependency</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> k : SubGraph) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If in the path to join the two instructions,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there is another high latency instruction,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or instructions colored for another block</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// abort the merge.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (DAG-&gt;IsHighLatencySU&#91;k&#93; || (CurrentColoring&#91;k&#93; != ProposedColor &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="normal">                                          CurrentColoring&#91;k&#93; != 0)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="normal">            CompatibleGroup = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="normal">            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="normal">          &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If one of the SU in the subgraph depends on the result of SU j,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there&#39;ll be a data dependency.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SIScheduleBlockCreator::colorExports() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ExportColor = NextNonReservedID++;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="normal">  SmallVector&lt;unsigned, 8&gt; ExpGroup;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Put all exports together in a block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The block will naturally end up being scheduled last,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// thus putting exports at the end of the schedule, which</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is better for performance.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However we must ensure, for safety, the exports can be put</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// together in the same block without any other instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This could happen, for example, when scheduling after regalloc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if reloading a spilled register from memory using the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// register than used in a previous export.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If that happens, do not regroup the exports.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SUNum : DAG-&gt;TopDownIndex2SU) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SUnit &amp;SU = DAG-&gt;SUnits&#91;SUNum&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/siinstrinfo/#a2d40ab246e329190bbf36cd93fd88e83">SIInstrInfo::isEXP</a>(&#42;SU.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#afc98c2c5417cad1a90fc4fe241fe8ba4">getInstr</a>())) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SU is an export instruction. Check whether one of its successor</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dependencies is a non-export, in which case we skip export grouping.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SDep &amp;SuccDep : SU.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#aab4a86c51e6b126c9c6ef58dbb574431">Succs</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SUnit &#42;SuccSU = SuccDep.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdep/#a03a2dc5f9f321a2ce28f5c641dfe5455">getSUnit</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SuccDep.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdep/#a21e3367f21a2b07ce6e344fc6a2ed078">isWeak</a>() || SuccSU-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#a3f708b119627541f144d703a1d183202">NodeNum</a> &gt;= DAG-&gt;SUnits.size()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ignore these dependencies.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1402"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1403"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Fill the usage of every output</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1404"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Warning: while by construction we always have a link between two blocks</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1405"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when one needs a result from the other, the number of users of an output</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1406"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is not the sum of child blocks having as input the same virtual register.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1407"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here is an example. A produces x and y. B eats x and produces x&#39;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1408"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// C eats x&#39; and y. The register coalescer may have attributed the same</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1409"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// virtual register to x and x&#39;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1410"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To count accurately, we do a topological sort. In case the register is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// found for several parents, we increment the usage of the one with the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// highest topological index.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1413"><Highlight kind="normal">  LiveOutRegsNumUsages.resize(Blocks.size());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1751"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Code adapted from scheduleDAG.cpp</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1752"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Does a topological sort over the SUs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1753"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both TopDown and BottomUp</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SIScheduleDAGMI::topologicalSort() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1755"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs/#a8cd3eede9e2a32c7139cc5c7c481e08b">Topo</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagtopologicalsort/#a44c5faa549f250a26b1303eb1a3ebd47">InitDAGTopologicalSorting</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1756"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1757"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sischeduledagmi/#a470670a7d9cc41bc1d5ed1b244fffd11">TopDownIndex2SU</a> = std::vector&lt;int&gt;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs/#a8cd3eede9e2a32c7139cc5c7c481e08b">Topo</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagtopologicalsort/#a6619b762bc4a668ff0fc63b0a9a9d405">begin</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs/#a8cd3eede9e2a32c7139cc5c7c481e08b">Topo</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagtopologicalsort/#a2fc48fc617dea5bb51be4a7210f63c25">end</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1758"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sischeduledagmi/#a1e9f5df7b765366ff598beafbe9ecd37">BottomUpIndex2SU</a> = std::vector&lt;int&gt;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs/#a8cd3eede9e2a32c7139cc5c7c481e08b">Topo</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagtopologicalsort/#ad0ab86f00424ef15aa14542a57b2798d">rbegin</a>(), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs/#a8cd3eede9e2a32c7139cc5c7c481e08b">Topo</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagtopologicalsort/#a1faf371bd07c60102c4cf7b334d5dac9">rend</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1759"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1760"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1761"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Move low latencies further from their user without</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1762"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// increasing SGPR usage (in general)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1763"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is to be replaced by a better pass that would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1764"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// take into account SGPR usage (based on VGPR Usage</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1765"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and the corresponding wavefront count), that would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1766"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// try to merge groups of loads if it make sense, etc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1767"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SIScheduleDAGMI::moveLowLatencies() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1768"><Highlight kind="normal">   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DAGSize = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledag/#a3d5aacd5fc7d6a739ce913974ed1e53d">SUnits</a>.size();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1769"><Highlight kind="normal">   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LastLowLatencyUser = -1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1770"><Highlight kind="normal">   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LastLowLatencyPos = -1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1771"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1772"><Highlight kind="normal">   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0, e = ScheduledSUnits.size(); i != e; ++i) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1773"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;SU = &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledag/#a3d5aacd5fc7d6a739ce913974ed1e53d">SUnits</a>&#91;ScheduledSUnits&#91;i&#93;&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1774"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsLowLatencyUser = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1775"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MinPos = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1776"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1777"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdep">SDep</a>&amp; PredDep : SU-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#ae2b43854b542de66eec6475adc48f56c">Preds</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1778"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;Pred = PredDep.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdep/#a03a2dc5f9f321a2ce28f5c641dfe5455">getSUnit</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1779"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SITII-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/siinstrinfo/#a975ccb82baef08d83e403c8818c52db8">isLowLatencyInstruction</a>(&#42;Pred-&gt;getInstr())) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1780"><Highlight kind="normal">        IsLowLatencyUser = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1781"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1782"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Pred-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#a3f708b119627541f144d703a1d183202">NodeNum</a> &gt;= DAGSize)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1783"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1784"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PredPos = ScheduledSUnitsInv&#91;Pred-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#a3f708b119627541f144d703a1d183202">NodeNum</a>&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1785"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (PredPos &gt;= MinPos)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1786"><Highlight kind="normal">        MinPos = PredPos + 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1787"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1788"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1789"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SITII-&gt;isLowLatencyInstruction(&#42;SU-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit/#afc98c2c5417cad1a90fc4fe241fe8ba4">getInstr</a>())) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1790"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BestPos = LastLowLatencyUser + 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01791" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1791"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)BestPos &lt;= LastLowLatencyPos)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1792"><Highlight kind="normal">        BestPos = LastLowLatencyPos + 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1793"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BestPos &lt; MinPos)</Highlight></CodeLine>
